H3.text: Electron bonds are not indicated by the formal charge calculated for an atom, which is only a useful bookkeeping procedure and does not reflect the actual charge of the atom in the molecule.

A4.text: In chemistry, a formal charge (F.C. or q*), in the covalent view of chemical bonding, is the hypothetical charge assigned to an atom in a molecule, assuming that electrons in all chemical bonds are shared equally between atoms, regardless of relative electronegativity.

A5.text: The formal charge system is just a method to keep track of all of the valence electrons that each atom brings with it when the molecule is formed.
